title: Can a Christian 'give back' salvation? - Quora

response.answer_text: You cannot give back your salvation. Romans 8:38–39 For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers, neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord.Once you repent and believe in Jesus Christ as your savior, that’s it. The love of God will never leave you. Salvation will always be yours whether you later try to reject it or not. So what happens to a saved person that later rejects God and his or her own salvation? 1 Corinthians 3:12–15 Anyone who builds on that foundation may use a variety of materials—gold, silver, jewels, wood, hay, or straw. But on the judgment day, fire will reveal what kind of work each builder has done. The fire will show if a person’s work has any value. If the work survives, that builder will receive a reward. But if the work is burned up, the builder will suffer great loss. The builder will be saved, but like someone barely escaping through a wall of flames.For me, I had MUCH rather be that terrible builder that losses sight of his salvation and screws up rather than be that person who never had the love of God that is in Jesus Christ our Lord.

If I understand it correctly the question is whether a Christian can stop being a Christian and give back his salvation. If a Christian feels like “giving back” his salvation, he or she never had it in the first place. The Christian would be ignoring the sacrifice and divinity of Jesus, which would be evidence that the Spirit of Jesus aka the Holy Spirit never resided in that person. Therefore this person was never born again and was only a “Christian” by title. 1 John 2:18–19 - many antichrists have come. Therefore we know that it is the last hour. They went out from us, but they did not really belong to us, because if they had belonged to us, they would have remained with us. But they went out from us to demonstrate that all of them do not belong to us.

Can a Christian "give back" salvation? No, once you are born again spiritually, you cannot be unborn. Just like when you are physically born, you cannot get unborn. Once Jesus saves you, it’s a done deal. Jesus doesn’t do things halfway. The thing I think you should understand is, your not going to be saved going in it with a less than a sincere attitude. God knows your heart better than you do and you cannot fool him. He searches the heart and when he sees that you fully trust him and come to the realization that you are in dire need of a savior because we are all sinners in the flesh, He saves you and nothing can take you from him.

Salvation doesn’t mean singing praises of glory to God for eternity. Salvation means being in the best place with all those you love and miss nothing. It would be an eternal home with bearable ups and down. where do you want to go after giving back salvation. The whole world of heavens can be your home if you attain salvation and never miss the loved ones. It might include dedicating one hour of boring worship in church or immensely interesting one day with God and his ability to preach with an incredibly interesting parables and stories. God worked for six days and rested on seventh day so I believe even angels have a work life, learning about the followers and protecting them.

Yes one can “loose” salvation forever. Hebrews 6:4–6 NASB 4 For in the case of those who have once been enlightened and have tasted of the heavenly gift and have been made partakers of the Holy Spirit, 5 and have tasted the good word of God and the powers of the age to come, 6 and then have fallen away, it is impossible to renew them again to repentance, since they again crucify to themselves the Son of God and put Him to open shame. Hebrews 10:26 NASB 26 For if we go on sinning willfully after receiving the knowledge of the truth, there no longer remains a sacrifice for sins,

No. When a person genuinely believes and receives Christ´s salvation it is not just some mental agreement that can be annulled or given back. The person is forgiven and will not come into eternal judgment and he/she becomes a child of God, he is regenerated with the eternal life of God. You cannot be unforgiven nor unborn of God, they are permanent and eternal truths.

That would be interesting. How do you know you were given salvation? You can turn away from salvation. Thousands of people do. I never heard of once saved always saved in scripture. If you reject god, you no longer saved logically. If you don’t open the gift you won’t benefit from what’s inside it. It’s not a bad thing to walk away from salvation but I’m not sure you can give it back. I guess it depends on how you view the nature of salvation.

What salvation? I'm skeptical of the whole salvation motif. If evolution is real, the creation myth in the book of Genesis is not literally real. Since evolution is real, creationism is not real. No original sin means no need for a redeemer/savior God. No fall from grace in the Garden of Eden, no Adam, no Jesus Christ. Evolution Rules, Science Proves, and Creationism Fools.

Can someone lose their salvation? Absolutely. “Once saved always saved” is one of the most bankrupt ideas in Christianity, and which is on the wane but is apparently still kicking around as seen from some of the responses. If one stops being a repentent follower of Christ, God grace will leave them and they will be lost should they die in that state. But God is gracious and if one repents and starts following Christ again, then the blood of Christ will cover them again.

If you were stupid and didn’t understand what you were talking about you might think you did. But any “Christian” who says that he doesn’t want salvation from Christ is no Christian at all, and frankly doesn’t understand any of the concepts to begin with because there’s no way on Earth you’d ever want to give it up

Hello. There are no human being that will give you salvation. Only Jesus can save us. His words are His truth. Read John 14:6. With that verse you will know why I believe in my Lord Jesus Christ. God bless you always! Rafael V. Nieto
